definition: to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Qian red also trained its first this ribbon dance, dance to magic.
sentences.chinese: 芊紅也練着自己的首本絲帶舞，舞得出神入化。

sentences.english: Her piano playing is absolute magic .
sentences.chinese: 她的鋼琴彈得真是出神入化。

sentences.english: It can be said that the artistic presentation of the novel has reached the acme of perfection.
sentences.chinese: 小說的藝術表現可以說是達到了出神入化的境界。

sentences.english: He acted his part to a tee.
sentences.chinese: 他的角色被演得出神入化。

sentences.english: Legend tales of a legendary warrior whose kungfu skills with the stuff of legend.
sentences.chinese: 有一位傳奇中的傳奇大俠，他的功夫可謂出神入化。

sentences.english: The man can write alphabetic characters such as China, superb?
sentences.chinese: 那個人能把拼音文字寫得像中國漢字這樣出神入化？

sentences.english: The Radix Astragli's clinical use of famous doctors through ages of China have reached to a very high level.
sentences.chinese: 歷代醫家對黃芪的應用達到了出神入化的境界。

definition: lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
exquisite/fine and delicate (usu. of works of art)
masterly/subtle and clever (or artwork, writing etc)
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
